data.title: Wrong bracket highlighting with Regular Expressions
data.body:
### Description

Atom is messing closing brackets when regular expressions are parsed
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a new JavaScript file.
2. Paste the code above

``` javascript
function foo(toTest){
  return new RegExp(/^[^{]+\{\s*\[bar \w/).test(toTest);
}
```
### Versions

atom 1.5.3
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.5.4

data.title: Hide Typescript generated JS files
data.body: ### Description When coding in Typescript, the typescript compiler compiles `.ts` files and generates `.js` files. This causes the tree to be clogged up by the generated `.js` files. ### Proposal Make `.ts` file look like a folder and store the generated `.js` files in the folder. ### Webstorm's solution ### atom-typescript issue This issue is a thorn in the flesh for the typescript community and has been an [issue](https://github.com/TypeStrong/atom-typescript/issues/253) for almost a year. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Download apm `apm install atom-typescript` 2. Save a `.ts` file. 3. Watch your file tree get swamped. ### Versions Atom 1.5.3 apm 1.6.0 npm 2.13.3 node 0.10.40 python 2.7.10 git 2.5.4

data.title: Orphan processes
data.body:
### Description

Atom leaves orphan `conhost` and `node` processes under Windows 10 Pro
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Launch Atom
2. Exit Atom

**Expected behavior:** Atom clean up correctly without leaving any process

**Actual behavior:** Atom leaves `conhost` and `node` processes
## Actual process tree
### Step 1

![step_1](http://i.imgur.com/ygT8Pz7.png)
### Step 2

![step_2](http://i.imgur.com/2FUEnYO.png)
### Versions

1.5.3

data.title: Make setting Atom as Default Editor for filetypes easier
data.body:
This is issue  #4893, which has been closed and  locked.  All I wish to say is that in my experience the problem is not fixed.  So it should be re-opened.
### Description

On Windows 10, I uninstalled Atom, downloaded the latest version from https://atom.io/, and installed it (Atom 1.5.3), expecting that its installer would bring the new functionality to my PC.
### Steps to Reproduce

I went to a code file, right-clicked on it, and went to the "Open With..." submenu. Atom was not in the mini list. Clicked "Choose another App".  

Sadly, there is no Atom-with-nice-green-icon in the list.  Options are:
- Keep using this app: atom.cmd (blank white icon; old, undesirable method of accessing Atom)
- Other options: Sublime, Vim, etc
- More apps (with down-arrow).

Clicking More apps brings up a bigger list of editors, and various unrelated applications.  Atom is not there.  Finally there is "Look for another app on this PC", which brings up the file explorer.

And so nothing has changed.
### Desired Behavior

Right click, Open With, "Choose Another App", check "Always use this app to open .xyz files", choose Atom-with-nice-green-icon which should be there, and it becomes the default editor. All .xyz files immediately receive the Atom file icon to show that they will be opened by Atom in future.
### Versions

atom version 1.5.3
apm version 1.6.0

data.title: Atom.exe command-line output cannot be redirected to a file/pipe
data.body:
### Description

On Windows atom.exe command-line does not respect redirecting output to a file (or pipe).
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open command-line.
2. Type `atom.exe -v -w >out.txt`
3. Check contents of `out.txt`

**Expected behavior:** `out.txt` contains Atom version.

**Actual behavior:** `out.txt` is empty and Atom version is printed to the console.
### Versions

1.5.3

data.title: Unnecessary trailing separator in contextual menu
data.body:
The contextual menu of the main editor view on Linux/Ubuntu contains an unnecessary separator at the end of the list items as outlined by the following red arrow:

![Unnecessary trailing separator](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1730702/13192891/13120b90-d771-11e5-9c05-4134fabe57e3.png)

This bar is not present in others menu so it would be better to remove it here for consistency.

On the implementation side, I imagine the drawer could merge two consecutive separators and remove a separator on the first or the last position, ie removing separators that define empty sections.

data.title: PATH enviroment variables not installed by default
data.body:
### Windows Version:

Windows 7 32bit.
### Atom Version:

Latest (AKA 1.5.3).
### Description of the Issue:

`apm` and `atom commands` aren't installed by default. The installer I used was **EXACTLY** taken from [atom.io](Https://www.atom.io).

Both the `where apm` and `where atom` commands found nothing.

I reinstalled `Atom` a couple of times, and still got the same issue.
### [SquirellSetup.log](https://gist.github.com/Nikitaw99/5ec3e454064268bb917d), sorry that half of it is in Russian.

data.title: Add more diagnostics information for better bug reports
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Create a "diagnostics API" that will allow `atom --version` and the about-view to display valuable diagnostics information, similar to what is collected by the notifications package for uncaught exceptions.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a terminal
2. Type `atom --version`

**Expected behavior:** Diagnostic information including all relevant version numbers, environment variables, etc

**Actual behavior:** See below
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.7.0-dev-b311707
Electron: 0.36.7
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

data.title: Make non-standard line-endings more visible (stylable)
data.body:
Could it be possible to make more visible lines ending who aren't the line ending by default?
In the status bar, on the left of the LF/CRLF/Mixed, I could see a warning icon or the text in red . (yes Mixed would be always with a warning)
And make in color: red; (or whatever easily seen) and always visible in the file each EOL who aren't the line ending by default.

I often receive file with which I have to work from many source. And they aren't always well formed. If Atom could warn me when it happen and where, I could more easily correct it or ask for the sender to correct it by pointing the error.

You can see https://github.com/atom/line-ending-selector/issues/23 my first issue on this matter. With an answer from Lee dohm who is a good start.

But that means having all invisible, visible. Not only the one who are an issue.

data.title: syntax themes: rendering issues with fontsizes > 100%
data.body:
![ppc_lineissue2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1710598/13176596/c362319a-d713-11e5-9896-a94048b5106b.png)

Defining a fontsize of more than `100%` for a certain css scope, such as `.heading-1` results in several rendering issues:
- Displaced lines, resulting in overlaps.
- gutters and cursor height does not match the actual line size / font height
- Bigger fontsized lines don't _soft wrap_ properly

This is no new issue and it's possibly difficult to prevent, as a lot depends on measuring lines heights etc. and having different sized characters certainly won't make it easier.
Some issues, such as a displaced cursor have been fixed previously eg. via https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/8811, but the above ones still exist, that's why I decided opening this issue to collect thoughts and to link connected issues here.
If those issues were nonexistant, some interesting/useful things would be possible in syntax themes.

Some discussion has happened here: https://github.com/nylki/pen-paper-coffee-syntax/issues/20

data.title: Splitting/Closing panes results in crash
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [?] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

```
Error:Pane has been destroyed
    at Pane.module.exports.Pane.activate (C:\Users\XXXXXX\Atom\resources\app.asar\src\pane.js:631:15)
    at Pane.module.exports.Pane.focus (C:\Users\XXXXXX\Atom\resources\app.asar\src\pane.js:207:21)
    at atom-pane.<anonymous> (C:\Users\XXXXXX\Atom\resources\app.asar\src\pane-element.js:50:23)
```
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Start with only one pane
2. On the pane: Right click > Split Left
3. On the right pane: Right click > Split Down
4. On the left pane: Right click > Close Pane
5. On the upper pane: Right click > Split Down
6. On the lower pane: Right click > Close Pane

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
1. After step 5: There are supposed to be three horizontal panes
2. After step 6: There are supposed to be two horizontal panes (the two upper ones)

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
1. After step 5: There are (still) only two panes
2. After step 6: The pane is not closed properly (the tab bar remains or the "empty" background is shown)
### Version

1.5.3 (atom-windows.zip) on Windows 7

data.title: remove Open Roadmap menu item, fixes #10884
Workspace.scan returned values' structures are different
data.body:
https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/workspace.coffee#L995

When file is modified, Atom use [TextBuffer.scan](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.5.3/TextBuffer#instance-scan) replace `directoriesForSearcher`, but `TextBuffer.scan`'s returned value is different with `directoriesForSearcher`.

What should I do when I used [Workspace.scan](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.5.3/Workspace#instance-scan) and the returned values' structures are different ?

data.title: Help -> Roadmap returns 404 site
data.body:
Help -> Roadmap in the toolbar links to https://atom.io/roadmap?app. This returns 404. 

Tested on Atom 1.6.0-beta4

data.title: Pass the notification manager when splitting panes
data.body:
Fixes #9587
Fixes atom/autosave#54
Fixes atom/tabs#241

Wasn't sure if this warranted tests.  I'll gladly add one if asked to.

data.title: Allow panels to have multiple items
data.body: At this time, our panes have multiple pane items with the ability to cycle between items and have tabs. Panels, on the other hand only support a single item. We should make panels allow multiple items as well.

data.title: Packages needed missing?

I've been trying to install Atom text editor on my home computer and I've been receiving the error below. I'm running Windows 10, and I have had this error serially. The first time I got this error it was because an instance of the "atom" folder already existed, but I deleted that and cleaned out all related files. data.title: File Rename input box doesn't scroll if the filename is very long
data.body: When renaming a file, if the filename is very long (too long to fit in the width of the Rename input box), the entire path will not show up and you can't horizontally scroll to see the end of the path. For example: 1. Right click on a file in the sidebar and go to Rename 2. If the file is short, for example, `index.hbs` it will show in its entirety in the input box versus 1. Right click and go to Rename 2. If the filename is long, it will not show. You cannot right-arrow or select/move to get to the end of it. ![rename-long](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/685195/13156274/4e840c30-d647-11e5-85e5-c3b80320d4b6.gif) You can delete part of the filename/path to shorten it enough to get the whole thing in the input box. You can still successfully rename the file. Correct behavior should be that the input box will scroll horizontally as you arrow/select over the entire filename so you can see the whole path and edit it. Version 1.5.3, OSX 10.11.3

data.title: [WIP] Defer package activation
Does atom-amd64.deb need a screenshot?
data.body:
I installed atom-amd64.deb using the Ubuntu Software Center. Completely painless. Maybe the deb needs to include a screenshot for the installer's sake?

![install](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1377460/13154056/e73d664a-d62b-11e5-8d06-89fb334af0ac.png)

data.title: Language grammar cson is completely undocumented
data.body: The latest official [documentation](https://atom.io/docs/latest/) makes no mention whatsoever of what a language grammar's cson should look like. Not which keys should go in it (`fileTypes`? `name`? `patterns`? `repository`?), not what those keys should contain, not which scope selectors should exist, **nothing**.

data.title: Load packages before deserializing state
data.body:
Fixes issue caught by @izuzak in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/10764#issuecomment-183709726
Refs https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/10743

I took this as an opportunity to clean up some of the craziness. Thus, I have probably broken something.

data.title: Windows 7 shell integration gone
data.body:
I used to work with atom on Windows 10 which had shell integration in context menu "Open in atom".
Now I have atom installed on Windows 7 on which I see no shell integration any more. How come?
